body:
**Actionable comments posted: 3**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.env.example: - Around line 6-10: The .env.example is ambiguous about OPC_POSTGRES_URL vs DATABASE_URL; clarify which variable the app reads and the precedence: state explicitly whether OPC_POSTGRES_URL is preferred, whether DATABASE_URL is a fallback, or if only one is used; update the file to explain which variable to set, that both are PostgreSQL connection strings, and remove the alternative line if only one is active; mention the exact variable names OPC_POSTGRES_URL and DATABASE_URL so readers know which to set. In `@README.md`: - Line 206: The ordered list numbering is incorrect‚Äîchange the list item "2. **Or export in shell** before running Claude:" to start with "1." so it continues correctly after the preceding code block (or alternatively remove the blank line before this item to preserve the "2." continuation); update the line containing the exact text "2. **Or export in shell** before running Claude:" accordingly to resolve the markdown linter warning. - Around line 194-213: Add explicit remote database setup steps to the README: under the remote PostgreSQL section, include commands that show how to create the pgvector extension on the remote DB and how to apply the schema from docker/init-schema.sql (using psql with -h, -U, -d and -f flags), and add a brief note pointing readers to .env.example for available environment variables; place this adjacent to the existing OPC_POSTGRES_URL examples so users can copy/paste the commands when configuring a remote instance. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between c52cdcc6689e6d77606c5eb94af4358d4a9cdf09 and 73d5ede946cbb26bf504c6b634f3e20832ded6f5.
üìí Files selected for processing (2) * `.env.example` * `README.md`
üß∞ Additional context used
ü™õ dotenv-linter (4.0.0)
.env.example [warning] 14-14: [UnorderedKey] The POSTGRES_PASSWORD key should go before the POSTGRES_USER key (UnorderedKey) --- [warning] 15-15: [UnorderedKey] The POSTGRES_DB key should go before the POSTGRES_PASSWORD key (UnorderedKey) --- [warning] 16-16: [UnorderedKey] The POSTGRES_PORT key should go before the POSTGRES_USER key (UnorderedKey)
ü™õ markdownlint-cli2 (0.18.1)
README.md 206-206: Ordered list item prefix Expected: 1; Actual: 2; Style: 1/1/1 (MD029, ol-prefix)
üîá Additional comments (3)
.env.example (1)
`1-21`: **LGTM! Clear documentation structure.** The `.env.example` file provides comprehensive guidance for environment variable configuration. The structure is clear with well-organized sections for PostgreSQL connection, Docker defaults, and optional API keys.
README.md (2)
`192-215`: **Well-structured documentation for remote database setup.** The new section clearly documents both configuration methods (settings.json and shell export) and includes the critical requirement about pgvector and schema initialization. The cross-reference to `.env.example` is helpful. --- `192-215`: **No action needed‚Äî"Remote Database Setup" section appears only once.** The search found only a single occurrence of the "Remote Database Setup" section in README.md at line 192. No duplication exists. > Likely an incorrect or invalid review comment.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.

**Actionable comments posted: 3**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In `@README.md`: - Around line 221-236: Add a brief security note after the shown OPC_POSTGRES_URL examples (after the block ending at line 236 / before line 238) reminding readers not to hardcode credentials in production and to use environment variables, secret managers, or .env files excluded from version control; insert a short blockquote-style line that clearly labels it as a Security Note. - Line 226: Update the Environment Variables table to document OPC_POSTGRES_URL as an alternative to DATABASE_URL: add a row with `OPC_POSTGRES_URL` | PostgreSQL connection string (alternative to `DATABASE_URL`) | No, and add a brief note near the table stating that `DATABASE_URL` is preferred because the setup wizard generates it; ensure examples in the README that currently use `OPC_POSTGRES_URL` are consistent with this note. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between 73d5ede946cbb26bf504c6b634f3e20832ded6f5 and c1a0cf44697764b2b1e51bb4e494c68644cb9478.
üìí Files selected for processing (1) * `README.md`
üîá Additional comments (2)
README.md (2)
`192-195`: **LGTM! Clear introduction to remote database setup.** The section is well-placed in Quick Start and clearly explains when users would need this configuration. --- `211-216`: **Excellent provider-specific guidance.** The managed PostgreSQL tips are helpful and cover the major providers. The note about `CREATE EXTENSION` privileges for self-hosted setups is particularly valuable.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.
